did.abstract: Ted and Betsy Lewin both graduated from Pratt Institute and have illustrated and authored multiple children and young adult books.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Ted Lewin was born 6 May 1935, in Buffalo, NY, the son of Sidney (a retail jeweler) and Bernece (Klehn) Lewin. He attended Pratt Institute of Art (B.F.A., 1956). Lewin has been received the following awards:

p.title: I Was a Teenage Professional Wrestler

bioghist.p: Booklist Editor's Choice List citation, 1993
School Library Journal Best Books Citation, 1993
ALA Notable Book citation, 1993
Caldecott Honor award, 1994
Bird Watch and The Day of Ahmed's Secret
ALA Notable Book citations
Texas Bluebonnet Award
Sydney Taylor Award, Association of Jewish Libraries,
National Jewish Book Award, Jewish Council,

Lewin served in the U.S. Army (1958) before becoming a professional wrestler (1952-1965) and then an artist and freelance illustrator (1956—). Lewin has also conducted one-man shows in the Laboratory of Ornithology, Cornell University (1978) and Central Park Zoo Gallery, as well as a group show at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

bioghist.p: Betsy Reilly Lewin was born 12 May 1937, in Clearfield, PA, the daughter of John K. (in insurance sales) and Winifred Dowler Reilly (a teacher). She attended Pratt Institute of Art (B.F.A., 1959). As a freelance writer and illustrator, Betsy Lewin has received the following awards:
Araminta's Paintbox, written by Karen Ackerman
Pick of the List, American Booksellers, 1990
Ho! Ho! Ho! The Complete Book of Christmas Words, written by Lynda Graham Barber
Pick of the List, American Booksellers, 1993
Yo! Hungry Wolf: A Nursery Rap, written by David Vozar
Children's Choice, 1994
Somebody Catch My Homework, written by David L. Harrison
Children's Choice, 1994
Best Books, School Library Journal, 1995

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains watercolor illustrations from two books by Ted Lewin [The Ghost of Grannoch Moor, William MacKellar, 1973 and The Witch of Glen Gowrie, William MacKellar, 1978] and one by Betsy Lewin [Araminta's Paintbox, Karen Ackerman, 1990]. Proofs for the last title are also included.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of children's literature and associated artwork. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.
